verses.kjv: And thou shalt make an altar to burn incense upon: of shittim wood shalt thou make it.
verses.web: “You shall make an altar to burn incense on. You shall make it of acacia wood.
verses.ct: "Build an altar for burning incense, and make it out of acacia wood.

verses.kjv: A cubit shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof; foursquare shall it be: and two cubits shall be the height thereof: the horns thereof shall be of the same.
verses.web: Its length shall be a cubit, and its width a cubit. It shall be square, and its height shall be two cubits. Its horns shall be of one piece with it.
verses.ct: It should be square — 1 cubit long and 1 cubit wide — and 2 cubits tall. Its horns must be carved from the same piece of wood as the altar itself.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, the top thereof, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns thereof; and thou shalt make unto it a crown of gold round about.
verses.web: You shall overlay it with pure gold, its top, its sides around it, and its horns; and you shall make a gold molding around it.
verses.ct: Cover the entire altar with pure gold — the top, all four sides, and the horns — and put a gold molding around the edge.

verses.kjv: And two golden rings shalt thou make to it under the crown of it, by the two corners thereof, upon the two sides of it shalt thou make it; and they shall be for places for the staves to bear it withal.
verses.web: You shall make two golden rings for it under its molding; on its two ribs, on its two sides you shall make them; and they shall be for places for poles with which to bear it.
verses.ct: Attach 2 gold rings beneath the molding on opposite sides. These will hold the carrying poles.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make the staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold.
verses.web: You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
verses.ct: Make the poles from acacia wood and cover them with gold.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put it before the vail that is by the ark of the testimony, before the mercy seat that is over the testimony, where I will meet with thee.
verses.web: You shall put it before the veil that is by the ark of the covenant, before the mercy seat that is over the covenant, where I will meet with you.
verses.ct: Place this altar in front of the curtain that hangs near the ark of the testimony, directly before the mercy seat that covers the testimony. That is where I will meet with you.

verses.kjv: And Aaron shall burn thereon sweet incense every morning: when he dresseth the lamps, he shall burn incense upon it.
verses.web: Aaron shall burn incense of sweet spices on it every morning. When he tends the lamps, he shall burn it.
verses.ct: Every morning when Aaron tends the lamps, he must burn fragrant incense on this altar.

verses.kjv: And when Aaron lighteth the lamps at even, he shall burn incense upon it, a perpetual incense before the LORD throughout your generations.
verses.web: When Aaron lights the lamps at evening, he shall burn it, a perpetual incense before LORD throughout your generations.
verses.ct: He must also burn incense on it when he lights the lamps at evening. This will be a perpetual offering of incense before the LORD, continuing through every generation.

verses.kjv: Ye shall offer no strange incense thereon, nor burnt sacrifice, nor meat offering; neither shall ye pour drink offering thereon.
verses.web: You shall offer no strange incense on it, nor burnt offering, nor meal offering; and you shall pour no drink offering on it.
verses.ct: Don't burn any unauthorized incense on this altar, and don't use it for burnt offerings, grain offerings, or drink offerings.

verses.kjv: And Aaron shall make an atonement upon the horns of it once in a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonements: once in the year shall he make atonement upon it throughout your generations: it is most holy unto the LORD.
verses.web: Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once in the year; with the blood of the sin offering of atonement once in the year he shall make atonement for it throughout your generations. It is most holy to LORD.”
verses.ct: Once a year, Aaron must perform atonement on the altar's horns using the blood from the sin offering of atonement. This annual atonement must be observed through every generation. This altar is most holy to the LORD."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses:

verses.kjv: When thou takest the sum of the children of Israel after their number, then shall they give every man a ransom for his soul unto the LORD, when thou numberest them; that there be no plague among them, when thou numberest them.
verses.web: “When you take a census of the children of Israel, according to those who are counted among them, then each man shall give a ransom for his soul to LORD, when you count them; that there be no plague among them when you count them.
verses.ct: "Whenever you take a census of the Israelites, each person counted must pay a ransom for his soul to the LORD. This will prevent any plague from striking them during the count.

verses.kjv: This they shall give, every one that passeth among them that are numbered, half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary: (a shekel is twenty gerahs:) an half shekel shall be the offering of the LORD.
verses.web: They shall give this, everyone who passes over to those who are counted, half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs); half a shekel for an offering to LORD.
verses.ct: Everyone who is counted must give half a shekel, measured by the sanctuary standard (a shekel equals 20 gerahs). This half shekel is an offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: Every one that passeth among them that are numbered, from twenty years old and above, shall give an offering unto the LORD.
verses.web: Everyone who passes over to those who are counted, from twenty years old and upward, shall give the offering to LORD.
verses.ct: Every person counted who is 20 years old or older must give this offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when they give an offering unto the LORD, to make an atonement for your souls.
verses.web: The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less, than the half shekel, when they give the offering of LORD, to make atonement for your souls.
verses.ct: The rich must not give more and the poor must not give less than half a shekel when presenting this offering to the LORD as atonement for your souls.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take the atonement money of the children of Israel, and shalt appoint it for the service of the tabernacle of the congregation; that it may be a memorial unto the children of Israel before the LORD, to make an atonement for your souls.
verses.web: You shall take the atonement money from the children of Israel, and shall appoint it for the service of the Tent of Meeting; that it may be a memorial for the children of Israel before LORD, to make atonement for your souls.”
verses.ct: Collect this atonement money from the Israelites and use it for the service of the Tabernacle. It will serve as a reminder before the LORD on behalf of the Israelites, making atonement for your souls."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses:

verses.kjv: Thou shalt also make a laver of brass, and his foot also of brass, to wash withal: and thou shalt put it between the tabernacle of the congregation and the altar, and thou shalt put water therein.
verses.web: “You shall also make a basin of bronze, and its base of bronze, in which to wash. You shall put it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it.
verses.ct: "Make a bronze basin with a bronze stand for washing. Place it between the Tabernacle and the altar, and fill it with water.

verses.kjv: For Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet thereat:
verses.web: Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet in it.
verses.ct: Aaron and his sons must wash their hands and feet from it.

verses.kjv: When they go into the tabernacle of the congregation, they shall wash with water, that they die not; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn offering made by fire unto the LORD:
verses.web: When they go into the Tent of Meeting, they shall wash with water, that they not die; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire to LORD.
verses.ct: They must wash with water before entering the Tabernacle, or they will die. The same applies whenever they approach the altar to serve — to burn an offering made by fire to the LORD.

verses.kjv: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they die not: and it shall be a statute for ever to them, even to him and to his seed throughout their generations.
verses.web: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they not die. This shall be a statute forever to them, even to him and to his descendants throughout their generations.”
verses.ct: They must wash their hands and feet so they don't die. This is a permanent rule for Aaron and his descendants through every generation."

verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: Moreover LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD also spoke to Moses:

verses.kjv: Take thou also unto thee principal spices, of pure myrrh five hundred shekels, and of sweet cinnamon half so much, even two hundred and fifty shekels, and of sweet calamus two hundred and fifty shekels,
verses.web: “Also take fine spices: of liquid myrrh, five hundred shekels; and of fragrant cinnamon half as much, even two hundred and fifty; and of fragrant cane, two hundred and fifty;
verses.ct: "Gather the finest spices: 500 shekels of liquid myrrh, 250 shekels of fragrant cinnamon, 250 shekels of fragrant calamus,

verses.kjv: And of cassia five hundred shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, and of oil olive an hin:
verses.web: and of cassia five hundred, according to the shekel of the sanctuary; and a hin of olive oil.
verses.ct: and 500 shekels of cassia — all measured by the sanctuary standard — along with a hin of olive oil.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make it an oil of holy ointment, an ointment compound after the art of the apothecary: it shall be an holy anointing oil.
verses.web: You shall make it into a holy anointing oil, a perfume compounded after the art of the perfumer: it shall be a holy anointing oil.
verses.ct: Blend these together using the skill of a perfumer to create a holy anointing oil. This will be the sacred anointing oil.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt anoint the tabernacle of the congregation therewith, and the ark of the testimony,
verses.web: You shall use it to anoint the Tent of Meeting, the ark of the covenant,
verses.ct: Use it to anoint the Tabernacle and the ark of the testimony,

verses.kjv: And the table and all his vessels, and the candlestick and his vessels, and the altar of incense,
verses.web: the table and all its articles, the lamp stand and its accessories, the altar of incense,
verses.ct: the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and its accessories, and the incense altar,

verses.kjv: And the altar of burnt offering with all his vessels, and the laver and his foot.
verses.web: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin with its base.
verses.ct: the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the basin with its stand.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt sanctify them, that they may be most holy: whatsoever toucheth them shall be holy.
verses.web: You shall sanctify them, that they may be most holy. Whatever touches them shall be holy.
verses.ct: Consecrate them so they become most holy. Anything that touches them will become holy.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, that they may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.web: You shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and sanctify them, that they may minister to me in the priest’s office.
verses.ct: Then anoint Aaron and his sons and consecrate them so they can serve me as priests.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, This shall be an holy anointing oil unto me throughout your generations.
verses.web: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘This shall be a holy anointing oil to me throughout your generations.
verses.ct: Tell the Israelites: 'This will be my holy anointing oil through every generation.

verses.kjv: Upon man’s flesh shall it not be poured, neither shall ye make any other like it, after the composition of it: it is holy, and it shall be holy unto you.
verses.web: It shall not be poured on man’s flesh, and do not make any like it, according to its composition. It is holy. It shall be holy to you.
verses.ct: It must never be poured on an ordinary person's body, and you must never make anything with the same formula. It is holy, and you must treat it as holy.

verses.kjv: Whosoever compoundeth any like it, or whosoever putteth any of it upon a stranger, shall even be cut off from his people.
verses.web: Whoever compounds any like it, or whoever puts any of it on a stranger, he shall be cut off from his people.’ ”
verses.ct: Anyone who makes a blend like it or puts any of it on an outsider will be cut off from his people.'"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take unto thee sweet spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum; these sweet spices with pure frankincense: of each shall there be a like weight:
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Take to yourself sweet spices, gum resin, onycha, and galbanum; sweet spices with pure frankincense. There shall be an equal weight of each.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Gather these fragrant spices: gum resin, onycha, galbanum, and pure frankincense — equal amounts of each.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make it a perfume, a confection after the art of the apothecary, tempered together, pure and holy:
verses.web: You shall make incense of it, a perfume after the art of the perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy.
verses.ct: Blend them into incense using the skill of a perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt beat some of it very small, and put of it before the testimony in the tabernacle of the congregation, where I will meet with thee: it shall be unto you most holy.
verses.web: You shall beat some of it very small, and put some of it before the covenant in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you. It shall be to you most holy.
verses.ct: Grind some of it into a fine powder and place it before the testimony in the Tabernacle, where I will meet with you. You must treat it as most holy.

verses.kjv: And as for the perfume which thou shalt make, ye shall not make to yourselves according to the composition thereof: it shall be unto thee holy for the LORD.
verses.web: The incense which you shall make, according to its composition you shall not make for yourselves: it shall be to you holy for LORD.
verses.ct: Never make this incense with the same formula for your own use. It is holy — set apart for the LORD.

verses.kjv: Whosoever shall make like unto that, to smell thereto, shall even be cut off from his people.
verses.web: Whoever shall make any like that, to smell of it, he shall be cut off from his people.”
verses.ct: Anyone who makes incense like it just to enjoy its fragrance will be cut off from his people."
